title: 15 Easy Cinco de Mayo Recipes for a Homemade Fiesta
description: Get easy Cinco de Mayo recipes including a main dish that cooks itself, super quick side dishes, make-ahead dessert, and a big pitcher of drinks.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 15 Easy Cinco de Mayo Recipes for a Homemade Fiesta By Vanessa Greaves Vanessa Greaves Vanessa Greaves is a Senior Editor at Allrecipes with nearly two decades of experience helping home cooks gain confidence in the kitchen. A self-taught cook who grew up reading cookbooks for fun, Vanessa lives and breathes the challenges faced by busy everyday cooks to get dinner on the table. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Published on March 6, 2020 Close Credits: bd.weld Cook up an easy Cinco de Mayo party with simple recipes that deliver big flavor without a whole lot of fuss. Here's everything you'll need to feed your fiesta, from a main dish that cooks itself and side dishes that come together in minutes, to a make-ahead dessert and a big pitcher of drinks. Just add your favorite chips and maybe a piñata. 01 of 15 Slow Cooker Carnitas View Recipe Save Tammy Lynn Thanks to the magic of your slow cooker, you can turn a few everyday ingredients and a boneless pork shoulder into a fragrant pot of fork-tender meat to stuff into soft tacos. Just load up the cooker in the morning and it's ready to party by the end of the day. 02 of 15 Quick and Easy Refried Beans View Recipe Save naples34102 It takes a mere 20 minutes to transform ordinary canned pinto beans into a flavorful side dish. You can spice it up or calm it down to suit your taste. Find more recipes for Mexican bean side dishes. 03 of 15 Ex-Girlfriend's Mom's Salsa Fresca (Pico de Gallo) View Recipe Save naples34102 Only five ingredients go into this super-fresh salsa, but you'll love how it picks up all the rest of the dishes on your menu and makes them dance. It needs to stand for 20 minutes to let the flavors blossom, so make this one before you tackle the guacamole. Shhh! Here are 7 top secrets for sensational homemade salsa. 04 of 15 Traditional Mexican Guacamole View Recipe Save Molly Freshly made guacamole beats store-bought every time, and with a simple 10-minute prep, you'll have a bowl of guac everyone will rave about. Check out this guide to making the best guacamole ever. 05 of 15 Arroz Rojo (Mexican Red Rice) View Recipe Save naples34102 This popular recipe takes only 15 minutes to prep and 25 minutes to simmer. You can make beans, guacamole, and salsa while the rice is cooking. See our entire collection of top-rated Mexican and Spanish rice recipes. 06 of 15 Beer Margaritas View Recipe Save docswife A big pitcher of margaritas is a whole lot easier to serve to a crowd. You can line up a bar-load of glasses ahead of time and rim the edges with salt, then let everyone help themselves. Get recipes for 16 Mexican-inspired cocktails. 07 of 15 Tres Leches Pina Colada Cake View Recipe Save Marilyn Martin Make this moist and tasty cake the night before and let it chill until you're ready to serve it up come party time. 08 of 15 Chicken Fajita Melts View Recipe Save A tray of these fajita-inspired melts won't last long at a party. The dish takes 35 minutes from prep to finish, including the five minutes it takes for the cheese to melt and brown in the broiler. 09 of 15 Elotes (Mexican Corn in a Cup) View Recipe Save lutzflcat You just need 15 minutes and five ingredients to prep this party-perfect dish. Top each cup with mayonnaise, Parmesan, chile-lime seasoning, and lime juice. Find our entire collection of corn salad recipes here. 10 of 15 Lime and Tequila Infused Strawberries View Recipe Save lutzflcat These boozy strawberries average five-star reviews and take just 15 minutes to prep. So, waiting an hour for the berries to absorb the lime juice and tequila is worth it. Just don't sneak too many of 'em while you're waiting. 11 of 15 White Cheese Dip View Recipe Save Soup Loving Nicole If you're a fan of queso blanco dips at Mexican restaurants, you'll want to add this six-ingredient, 25-minute recipe to your Cinco de Mayo lineup. 12 of 15 Ridiculously Easy Queso Fresco "Dip" View Recipe Save bd.weld "It's so ridiculously easy and looks much more refined than classic chile con queso," recipe creator Jillian Eileen says. "Serve with tortilla chips and enjoy." 13 of 15 Apple Enchilada Dessert View Recipe Save bd.weld "I have used this recipe several times and love how quick and easy it is. I can put them in the oven just before we start eating dinner, and dessert is ready when we are," home cook Nikki says. 14 of 15 Sheet Pan Nachos View Recipe Save bd.weld Cook ground beef in a skillet before piling it onto tortilla chips alongside cheese, olives, and jalapeños. Bake it for 20 minutes, and bam. You've found your new go-to appetizer. Spread a little Tex-Mex magic with top-rated nacho recipes. 15 of 15 Micheladas with Tajin View Recipe Save Yoly Have five minutes? Spice up dark beer with ingredients like chile-lime seasoning, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire, and tomato juice to create your own micheladas. See our entire collection of Cinco de Mayo recipes. Explore more: Recipes Holidays and Events Recipes Cinco de Mayo Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
